data.title: 2022 Causes of Deaths in the Philippines (Preliminary as of 28 February 2023)
data.meta_description: The top three causes of death in the country from January to December of 2022 were ischaemic heart diseases, neoplasms, and cerebrovascular diseases. The leading causes of death in the same period in 2021 were ischaemic heart diseases, cerebrovascular diseases, and COVID-19 virus identified. From January to December of 2022, ischaemic heart diseases were the leading cause of death with 114,557 cases or 18.4 percent of the total deaths in the country. On the other hand, neoplasms, came in second with 63,377 deaths (10.2% share). Cerebrovascular diseases were the third leading cause which accounted for 63,281 recorded cases (10.2% share) from January to December 2022. Deaths due to diabetes mellitus recorded 39,193 cases or 6.3 percent share, making it the fourth leading cause of death, while deaths due to hypertensive diseases, which ranked fifth, recorded 35,641 cases or 5.7 percent share. (Figure 1 and Table 1)
data.text:
Ischaemic heart diseases, neoplasms, and cerebrovascular diseases lead the causes of death in the Philippines

The top three causes of death in the country from January to December of 2022 were ischaemic heart diseases, neoplasms, and cerebrovascular diseases. The leading causes of death in the same period in 2021 were ischaemic heart diseases, cerebrovascular diseases, and COVID-19 virus identified. From January to December of 2022, ischaemic heart diseases were the leading cause of death with 114,557 cases or 18.4 percent of the total deaths in the country. On the other hand, neoplasms, came in second with 63,377 deaths (10.2% share). Cerebrovascular diseases were the third leading cause which accounted for 63,281 recorded cases (10.2% share) from January to December 2022. Deaths due to diabetes mellitus recorded 39,193 cases or 6.3 percent share, making it the fourth leading cause of death, while deaths due to hypertensive diseases, which ranked fifth, recorded 35,641 cases or 5.7 percent share. (Figure 1 and Table 1)

Deaths due to Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) decreased substantially in 2022

Registered deaths due to COVID-19 accounted for a total of 17,011 deaths or 2.7 percent of the total registered deaths from January to December 2022. This shows a decline of -84.9 percent from the 112,772 deaths due to COVID-19 that were registered in the same period in 2021. By classification, COVID-19 with virus identified was the 11th leading cause of death in the country with 12,085 cases or 1.9 percent of the total deaths. It was ranked 3rd in the same period in 2021 with 79,423 deaths or 9.0 percent of the total deaths. Meanwhile, registered deaths due to COVID-19 with virus not identified accounted for 4,926 or 0.8 percent of the total deaths, down from 8th in 2021 to 23rd as the leading cause of death in the country in 2022. (Figure 1 and Table 1)

Four regions report more than a thousand COVID-19 deaths

Among the 17 regions, National Capital Region (NCR) registered the highest number of deaths due to COVID-19 with 4,231 or 24.9 percent of the total COVID-19 deaths from January to December 2022. Region IV-A (CALABARZON) ranked second with 2,789 deaths (16.4% share), Central Luzon came in third with 2,283 deaths (13.4% share), while Western Visayas was fourth with 1,210 deaths (7.1% share). On the other hand, BARMM reported the least number of registered COVID-19 deaths with only 42 cases (0.2% share). (Figure 2 and Table 2)

Quezon City registers most COVID-19 deaths in NCR

In NCR, Quezon City reported the highest number of deaths due to COVID-19, with 862 deaths or 20.4 percent of the total COVID-19 deaths in the region from January to December 2022. This was followed by the City of Manila and City of Pasig with 608 (14.4% share) and 454 (10.7% share) COVID-19 deaths, respectively. (Figure 3 and Table 3)

CLAIRE DENNIS S. MAPA, Ph.D.
